required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Remote Pulmonary Function Testing in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (Pilot)
clinical_study.official_title: Remote Pulmonary Function Testing in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (Pilot)

brief_summary.textblock: The specific objective of this study is to validate the practice of remote pulmonary function testing (rPFT) conducted in the home through the use of connected mobile health devices and the Penn State Hershey ALS Telemanagement program.

detailed_description.textblock:
The specific objective of this study is to validate the practice of remote pulmonary function testing (rPFT) conducted in the home through the use of connected mobile health devices and the Penn State Hershey ALS Telemanagement program. The central hypothesis is that guided home assessment of respiratory function is a valid method for detecting respiratory insufficiency leading to noninvasive ventilation (NIV) recommendation. This study has the potential to transform the current practice of conducting breathing assessments every three months, resulting in timelier detection of respiratory insufficiency, thereby staining quality of life and lengthening survival. This protocol has the potential to demonstrate telemanagement exceeding the standards of ALS care.
This is a self-controlled study which will enroll 40 patients from the ALS clinic. On the day of their clinical visit, study participants will perform both a standard PFT as well as a simulated rPFT, both generating three valid repetitions of forced vital capacity (FVC) and maximal inspiratory pressure (MIP) procedures. The simulated rPFT will mimic the practice of home telemonitoring by having patients be instructed by a respiratory therapist over the telemanagement portal while in a research room within the ALS clinic. The primary hypothesis is that there is no difference in the results of PFT and rPFT for respiratory assessment of FVC and MIP.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A self-controlled validation study of experimental remote PFT assessment vs standard of care (non-randomized)

primary_outcome.description: Respiratory therapist will administer three valid maneuvers of forced vital capacity (FVC) The best FVC value is the outcome.
Respiratory therapist will administer three valid maneuvers of maximal inspiratory pressure (MIP). The best MIP value is the outcome.
Respiratory therapist will use the telehealth interface to guide the patient and caregiver to self-administer three valid FVC maneuvers. The best FVC value is the outcome.
Respiratory therapist will use the telehealth interface to guide the patient and caregiver to self-administer three valid MIP maneuvers. The best MIP value is the outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minute survey administered following completion of standard and remote PFT of Part 1
secondary_outcome.description: Survey responses from the patient/caregiver pair. Likert-type scales are used to generate subscores pertaining to: General Acceptability, Forced Vital Capacity Acceptability, and Maximal Inspiratory Pressure Acceptability. Subscales (evaluated separately): General Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best)] Forced Vital Capacity Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best) Maximal Inspiratory Pressure Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best)]

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minute survey administered following completion of standard and remote PFT of Part 1
secondary_outcome.description: Survey responses from the respiratory therapist. Likert-type scales are used to generate subscores pertaining to: General Acceptability, Forced Vital Capacity Acceptability, and Maximal Inspiratory Pressure Acceptability. Subscales (evaluated separately): General Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best)] Forced Vital Capacity Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best) Maximal Inspiratory Pressure Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best)]

arm_group.description: Subjects in this arm perform both standard and remote PFT assessments in order to validate the procedure.

intervention.description: Telemedicine delivery of pulmonary function testing in ALS, including Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) and Maximal Inspiratory Pressure (MIP)
Standard clinical delivery of pulmonary function testing in ALS, including Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) and Maximal Inspiratory Pressure (MIP)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Part 1
Patients:
1. Possess a diagnosis of definite, probable, probable laboratory-supported, or possible ALS by revised El Escorial research criteria [Brooks2000].
2. Be 18 years of age or older.
3. Have a caregiver available to participate in the study
Caregivers:
1. Be 18 years of age or older, of either gender.
2. Be able and willing to provide informed consent.
Respiratory Therapist
1. Be a member of the Hershey Medical Center ALS multidisciplinary care team.
2. Be able and willing to provide verbal informed consent after receiving a summary explanation of research (SER).
Part 2 imposes additional inclusion criteria for patients only.
Patients:
4) Symptom onset within the last three years. 5) Have a computer and home internet service sufﬁcient for engaging in telemedicine sessions.
6) Have a second device capable of downloading the spirometer application from an app store (Android- or iOS-based smartphone or tablet).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion criteria are the same for both parts of the study.
Patients:
1. Use of NIV or diaphragm pacer at time of obtaining informed consent.
2. FVC ≤50% predicted or MIP > -60 cm H2O.
3. ALS Functional Rating Scale (ALSFRS-R) [Cedarbaum1999] score on day of screening of ≥2 on items for speech, swallowing, and salivation. These items are indicators of bulbar dysfunction, which limits the reliability of PFT administration.
4. Cognitive impairment, as judged by the ALS clinic neurologist, that prevents participation in the study.
Caregivers: None
Respiratory Therapists: None

patient_data.ipd_description: No plan at this time to share data with other researchers

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 49 subjects (including 3 patients not completing procedures, 3 controls, and 3 therapists)

group.title: Remote PFT (rPFT) Validation
group.description: Those in the first part of the study will perform both standard and remote PFT assessments in order to validate the procedure.

participants_list.participants: Subjects did both standard and remote assessments in the validation study. Total enrollment 49.
3 therapists enrolled. 3 ctrls enrolled (not incl. in analysis). 3 pts enr. but not completed.

baseline.population: Only patients who completed validation procedures are included (40 total). Recruitment has not yet begun for the second, randomized phase of the protocol, which involves enrollment into the standard PFT and remote PFT strudy arms.

group.title: Remote PFT (rPFT) Validation
group.description: Subjects perform both standard and remote PFT assessments in order to validate the procedure.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: ALS Functional Rating Scale - Revised (ALSFRS-R)
measure.description: Scale that measures physical function in bulbar, fine motor, gross motor, and breathing domains. Total score ranges from 0-48. Higher numbers indicate normal function. Lower numbers indicate impaired function.

outcome.title: Standard PFT - Forced Vital Capacity
outcome.description: Respiratory therapist will administer three valid maneuvers of forced vital capacity (FVC) The best FVC value is the outcome.
outcome.population: 40 patients taking part in validation study

outcome.title: Patient and Caregiver Reported Outcomes
outcome.description: Survey responses from the patient/caregiver pair. Likert-type scales are used to generate subscores pertaining to: General Acceptability, Forced Vital Capacity Acceptability, and Maximal Inspiratory Pressure Acceptability. Subscales (evaluated separately): General Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best)] Forced Vital Capacity Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best) Maximal Inspiratory Pressure Acceptability [0-5 (worst-best)]
outcome.time_frame: 10 minute survey administered following completion of standard and remote PFT of Part 1
outcome.population: One subject did not complete the survey

reported_events.time_frame: For the validation study, adverse event data was collected over the period of the procedures, approximately 20 minutes.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
